Internet Remarks: Presenting THE CURVE, a one-of-a-kind organic West Coast Modern architectural achievement by OpenSpace Architecture.  The excitement begins as you approach a double-lot at the end of Sunset Lane, the driveway gently flows downward to a park setting. Suddenly you discover the homes's curvy forms take shape, with its bold use of wood, bronze, and glass. As you step into the house you're entranced by its massive panoramic views. This 4BD/4.5BA jewel is custom craftsmanship throughout: Unique 'KING' truss system forged in UK, Bulthaup custom kitchen, Basalt stonework throughout, wide-plank white oak flooring, towering vertical lift doors to outdoor area, soaring 20ft 'living-wall'. There is nothing like this in all of Vancouver...seeing is believing!

Public Remarks: This architectural masterpiece captures the splendor of iconic modernism, and yet, it is tucked away within the city’s most traditional and exclusive First Shaughnessy. Built in 2006 by one of Canada’s premier architects, Richard Henriquez—recipient of the Order of Canada & the Governor General’s Medal—the 5,186 square-foot home sits on a 14,811 square-foot lot surrounded by lush landscaping. The work of art is the product of an intense decade-long collaboration between architect & owner, Gordon Shrum. No detail was overlooked by the duo. The placement of indoor and outdoor lighting is a stroke of precision craftsmanship. The home is spread over three levels, and exposed concrete is juxtaposed with the warmth of natural finishes. Rarely does such an extraordinary home come onto the market.

Public Remarks: Presenting this 5,008 sqft property known as Kew House on a 1.67 acre (72,745 sqft) panoramic water-view lot, built in 1937, which was originally the dwelling of A.J. Taylor, president of British Pacific Properties. Mr Taylor was responsible for the Lions Gate Bridge construction and development of the British Properties. This beautifully maintained property boasts wonderful millwork, beamed ceilings, cove and base mouldings, antique light fixtures and chandeliers, Spanish tile, herringbone hardwood flooring. Total privacy from the main road, accessed by a long sweeping driveway, surrounded by tall mature trees and foliage opening out to the house with panoramic water views from the terrace, patios and west facing windows.

Public Remarks: 1363 The Crescent. Located right on the circle in first Shaughnessy. This mansion was built circa 1910 in an 18th Century New England Georgian style. Features a pedimented 3-part facade, plastered clapboard walls, a hipped roof, a carved entrance porch and sash windows. Entertain in the grand dining room which overlooks a lush, north facing garden with city and mountain views. This masterpiece needs a full restoration to bring it back to its former glory. Renowned private schools: York House, Little Flower Academy, and St. George's nearby. Infill potential with an option to stratify if so desired. Heritage B designation.

Public Remarks: Here is the last big piece of property available right in the heart of the Sunshine Coast 1 block off of the ocean. Current zoning allows for light industrial/commercial business park with residential. Currently halted in the rezoning process with the need to complete the master plan. Sechelt would like more density and affordable housing. This site lends it self exactly to this. Private sewer flow paid for to the Sechelt Indian Band 400 meters away. Build a few hundred residential doors on half of the property and then a commercial light industrial park on the other half. Can also be subdivided. 2 million worth of infrastructure already installed. CMHC has granted seed funds for the development of a market rental site should there be a desire. This really is a blank canvas, bring ideas.

Internet Remarks: The Narod Home. This sensational, one of a kind home was custom designed in 1974 by the Narod family along with celebrated architect and friend, Ron Thom. It is perched at the far end of exclusive Cameron Avenue on an extraordinarily private lot with an astounding 120 feet of water frontage offering unparalleled views towards the Gulf Islands, North Shore Mountains, downtown Vancouver and the homes along Point Grey Road. With a low profile and private facade from the road, the home cascades down the slope and rises well above the ocean over which it is built.  At 4,200 square feet over just two levels and a massive 816 square foot deck, the sprawling space is perfect for family and entertaining. The spacious living and dining room, eat-in kitchen, study, rec-room and three spacious bedrooms feature quintessential Ron Thom modernist design elements such as exposed beams, deep eaves, large glass walls, stepped ceilings with a singular focus on the breathtaking views from every room.
